second_reading.title: Letter to the Philippians
second_reading.text:
[[Ph 3,17]]Join with others in being imitators of me, brothers and sisters, and observe those who thus conduct themselves according to the model you have in us.
[[Ph 3,18]]For many, as I have often told you and now tell you even in tears, conduct themselves as enemies of the cross of Christ.
[[Ph 3,19]]Their end is destruction. Their God is their stomach; their glory is in their "shame." Their minds are occupied with earthly things.
[[Ph 3,20]]But our citizenship is in heaven, and from it we also await a savior, the Lord Jesus Christ.
[[Ph 3,21]]He will change our lowly body to conform with his glorified body by the power that enables him also to bring all things into subjection to himself.
[[Ph 4,1]]Therefore, my brothers, whom I love and long for, my joy and crown, in this way stand firm in the Lord, beloved.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 9,28b]]Jesus took Peter, John, and James and went up the mountain to pray.
[[Lc 9,29]]While he was praying his face changed in appearance and his clothing became dazzling white.
[[Lc 9,30]]And behold, two men were conversing with him, Moses and Elijah,
[[Lc 9,31]]who appeared in glory and spoke of his exodus that he was going to accomplish in Jerusalem.
[[Lc 9,32]]Peter and his companions had been overcome by sleep, but becoming fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.
[[Lc 9,33]]As they were about to part from him, Peter said to Jesus, "Master, it is good that we are here; let us make three tents, one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah." But he did not know what he was saying.
[[Lc 9,34]]While he was still speaking, a cloud came and cast a shadow over them, and they became frightened when they entered the cloud.
[[Lc 9,35]]Then from the cloud came a voice that said, "This is my chosen Son; listen to him."
[[Lc 9,36]]After the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. They fell silent and did not at that time tell anyone what they had seen.

first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
first_reading.text:
[[Gn 15,5]]The Lord God took Abraham outside and said: "Look up at the sky and count the stars, if you can. Just so," he added, "shall your descendants be."
[[Gn 15,6]]Abram put his faith in the LORD, who credited it to him as an act of righteousness.
[[Gn 15,7]]He then said to him, "I am the LORD who brought you from Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land as a possession."
[[Gn 15,8]]"O Lord GOD," he asked, "How am I to know that I shall possess it?"
[[Gn 15,9]]He answered him, "Bring me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtle-dove, and a young pigeon."
[[Gn 15,10]]He brought him all these, split them in two, and placed each half opposite the other; but the birds he did not cut up.
[[Gn 15,11]]Birds of prey swooped down on the carcasses, but Abram stayed with them.
[[Gn 15,12]]As the sun was about to set, a trance fell upon Abram, and a deep, terrifying darkness enveloped him.
[[Gn 15,17]]When the sun had set and it was dark, there appeared a smoking brazier and a flaming torch, which passed between those pieces.
[[Gn 15,18]]It was on that occasion that the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying: "To your descendants I give this land, from the Wadi of Egypt to the Great River (the Euphrates)."
